items.title: Govt notifies IFSCA fund management regulations: Lower minimum corpus, extended PPM validity
items.description: The requirement of listing of close-ended retail schemes on recognized stock exchanges has been made optional if minimum amount of investment by each investor in the scheme is at least $10,000.

items.title: NSDL, CDSL join hands with Sebi for a Unified Investor Platform, Madhabi Puri says investing getting democratized
items.description: The platform will consolidate fragmented financial data into a single, accessible space, and promises to revolutionize how investors manage their portfolios.

items.title: Top gainers and losers today: Stocks that moved the most on February 20
items.description: Sensex and Nifty extend loss to third consecutive session; Broader indices rose by 1% each. Nifty Energy and Metals saw extend gains while Bank Nifty, IT, FMCG indices were among the top laggards.

items.title: Taking Stock: Nifty closes above 22,900, Sensex falls 203 pts; auto, metals shine, banks drag
items.description: HDFC Bank, Maruti Suzuki, Tech Mahindra, HCL Technologies and Tata Consumer are among major losers on the Nifty, while gainers are Shriram Finance, NTPC, Adani Ports, M&M, Bharat Electronics

items.title: NTPC shares jump over 3% over Sri Lanka solar power plant project
items.description: Sri Lanka's Cabinet approved the establishment of two solar power plants in Sampur, Trincomalee with the company, a cabinet spokesperson was quoted as saying.

items.title: Live: Sensex, Nifty extends loss to third straight day | Closing Bell
items.description: Sensex slips over 100 pts, below 76,000. Nifty slips on expiry day, extends loss to 3rd day. Broader indices exhibit resilience, rise 1% each. Nifty Auto rebounds, rises over 1%. Nifty Energy, Metal extend gains to 3rd session. Bank Nifty, IT, FMCG indices top laggards. Catch Lovisha Darad and Yatin Mota as they discuss stocks on their radar.

items.title: Reluctance, lack of awareness and vested business interests limit growth of accredited investors as only around 200 register in 4 yrs
items.description: Sources further told Moneycontrol that market intermediaries including PMS and AIF firms are also not encouraging pushing accreditation hard enough because it threatens their own business and bottom line. Reason being, accredited investors are allowed to bypass the minimum ticket size for PMS and AIFs.

items.title: Buy KEI Industries; target of Rs 4103: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: Geojit Financial Services is bullish on KEI Industries has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 4103 in its research report dated February 20, 2025.

items.title: Accumulate Triveni Turbine; target of Rs 656: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: Geojit Financial Services recommended accumulate rating on Triveni Turbine with a target price of Rs 656 in its research report dated February 20, 2025.

items.title: Accumulate Muthoot Finance; target of Rs 2512: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: Geojit Financial Services recommended accumulate rating on Muthoot Finance with a target price of Rs 2512 in its research report dated February 20, 2025.

items.title: Radico Khaitan stock gains 5% as Royal Ranthambore Whisky enters CSD network
items.description: With blended scotch whisky sales in CSD exceeding 10 lakh cases annually, the company aims to capture around 10 percent of the market over the next year.

items.title: Small, midcap indices extend rise to 2nd day: Linde India, Windlas Biotech among top gainers
items.description: 'Both Smallcap and Microcap indices have formed bullish engulfing candlestick patterns on the daily chart, indicating a probable trend reversal,' says Vinay Rajani, Senior Technical & Derivative Analyst at HDFC Securities.

items.title: Shares of JBM Auto take a breather, down 3% a day after massive rally on Rs 5,500 crore eBus order
items.description: Shares of JBM Auto are taking a breather, a day after a stellar 19 percent rally that it saw following a major e-bus order from the government.

items.title: Tata Power shares rally 4% as HSBC upgrades to 'hold'
items.description: International brokerage HSBC upgraded its rating on Tata Power shares to 'hold' from 'reduce' earlier.

items.title: Just Dial shares surge 9% amid heavy volumes; Nuvama upgrades to 'buy'
items.description: Nuvama views Just Dial shares as an attractive opportunity, with its core business available at a compelling valuation after adjusting for cash. The firm foresees the scope for a 36% upside in the stock.

items.title: M&M shares jump 2% after group partners with Anduril to build autonomous maritime systems
items.description: The Thar-maker's stock has been under constant pressure, falling nearly 6 percent over the past 5 days. This comes amid concerns over Trump's tariff threats and Tesla's entry into the Indian market.

items.title: SUVs to drive PV growth in FY26, OEMs remain cautious on overall demand: Industry sources
items.description: The cautious stance on overall PV growth reflects multiple factors, including high base effects, fluctuating consumer sentiment, and macroeconomic uncertainties.

items.title: Bajaj Finance shares slip as UBS issues "Sell" rating, sees 18% potential downside
items.description: UBS analysts remain wary of Bajaj Finance’s trajectory in 2025, citing concerns over persistently high credit costs

items.title: CLSA upgrades NHPC to 'high conviction outperform'; shares jump 4%
items.description: The correction in NHPC's stock can give investors an inexpensive opportunity to accumulate, noted brokerage CLSA.

items.title: Tata Tech, IREDA stocks to enter F&O segment from February 28 on NSE; shares trade in green
items.description: Investors will be able to participate in F&O contracts of the two securities as the March series begins, following the expiry of the ongoing February series on February 27.

items.title: US markets open lower: S&P 500 down 0.7%, Dow Jones down 0.9%
items.description: US Markets Open Lower as Trump’s Tariff Proposals and Fed Rate Hike Expectations Stir Investor Uncertainty
